activities: Cytec collects and uses personal information for human resource management such as global enterprise headcount reporting, statistical analysis, compensation planning and related transactions, career development, external candidate staffing and recruitment, communications with shareholders, employees, retirees and their families, maintaining accurate benefits records, security issues, health and safety management, internal investigations, ethics investigations, governmental agency and judicial inquiries, tracking usage of Cytec’s property, intellectual property purposes, medical case management and mergers, acquisitions and divestitures.
eucountries: Belgium, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom
recoursemech: American Arbitration Association (ICDR/AAA Safe Harbor Program) for all claims other than those claims relating to Human Resource information.  For claims related to Human Resource information, these will be subject to the dispute resolution program provided by the European Data Protection Authorities.
